result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlin C Pillman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 3/21/2019 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect six (6) days of sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $500.00 fine plus court costs. If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
DOC COLLECT

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No contact with any victim, from either case, without the victim and probation agent's consent. Defendant may have contact with his own children consistent with any family court orders, otherwise no contact with minors at agent's discretion.
---------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------------

Defendant Carlin C Pillman in court with attorney Larry David Steen and attorney Jerome Buting.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 10:44 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court on State's motion to join 14CF413 & 17CF591. Court addresses parties as to Judge Drettwan's decision in prior Denny motion and asks for State's response.
10:45 a.m. - Argument by Atty. Johnson. Response by the Court that he is not sure of Atty. Johnson's position due to the differences in the charges. 
10:46 a.m. - Response/argument by Atty. Buting as to prior decision of Judge Drettwan and State's argument. Response by the Court. Response by Atty. Buting, who also responds to Court's questions.
10:51 a.m. - Court addresses Atty. Johnson as to her position regarding trying exposing counts separately. Response/record by Atty. Johnson who supplements her argument as to State's position. Atty. Johnson responds to further questions by the Court.
10:57 a.m. - Response/argument by Atty. Buting
11:00 a.m. - Response by the Court who makes a record and finds that joining of these files for trial will invoke prejudice and denies motion for joinder. Court goes off the record for scheduling. Court instructs ADA Johnson to prepare order denying motion to join.
11:11 a.m. - Request by Atty. Steen to amend bond. Response by ADA Johnson who objects to any amendment to the bond.  Court takes recess to review family file.
11:18 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Court makes a record and believes that family court is the best court to make decision regarding children and denies motion for modification of bond at this time. 
Parties have nothing further. 
Court in recess @ 11:19 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 25, 2018 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.

**TRANSCRIPT FILED 7/19/18: COURT REPORTER MAGIE BRADY**
Defendant's Brief in Opposition to State's Motion to Join Walworth County Case Nos. 2014-CF-413 and 2017-CF-591
Order on Defendant's Motion to Suppress Statements
Motion to Join
State's Brief in Support of Mt to Join

Defendant Carlin C Pillman in court with attorney Larry David Steen and Jerome Buting.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 1:30 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference on file 14CF413 and arraignment on 17CF591.
17-CF-591 - Defendant enters not guilty plea and trial reserved.
Court addresses ADA Johnson as to whether she will be filing a motion for joinder. Defense will object to joinder. State to file formal motion by May 21, 2018 and defense to file response by June 11, 2018. Court sets matter for motion hearing.
Record by Atty. Steen that they have filed substitution request and asks if matter will be assigned to this court. Court responds that matter will remain with him so both cases can be heard at the same time.
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess @1:36 p.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 8, 2018 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Carlin C Pillman in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in session @ 10:04 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference. Court addresses parties as to how they want proceed. Response/record by ADA Jambois that he believes that they will be filing a motion to join files and set both matters for trial.  Record by Atty. Steen that he does not believe there is a good case for joinder. Record as to pending file that is assigned to Judge Koss. Atty. Steen is planning on discussion with the state, but if Court wants to set for jury trial at this point and time for three days, he has no objection. Other option would be to set out to allow for discussion. Response by Atty. Jambois that he would request a status conference 3 weeks out to allow for preliminary hearing in pending matter to be heard and time to file motion for joinder.
10:10 a.m. - Response/record by the Court that status hearing makes sense at this point.
Parties have nothing further. Court in recess @ 10:11 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2018 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 23, 2018 at 01:30 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Carlin C Pillman in court with attorney Larry David Steen.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2018 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
11:50 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Carlin C Pillman in court with Attys Jerome F. Buting and Larry D. Steen.  
Matter is on today for a final pre-trial for a trial set to start on Monday.  
State had filed Motion in Limine on September 21st. Court understands that the parties have an agreement.  
Atty Johnson indicates that the specific information still encompasses other acts.  
None of the images will be shown or gone into in great detail.  
Response by Atty Buting.  He reads agreed stipulation into the Court record.  
Atty Johnson provides Court will copy of their stipulation.  Response by Atty Johnson.  
Discussion between Court & Attys concerning what Forensic Examiner will testify to at trial.  
Court sees no problem with allowing expert to testify to specific things stated in the stipulation.  
Discussion as to what expert will be testifying to generally.  
Given State's offer of proof, the Court will allow the State to leave it in as May 11 through Sept. 18.  
Defense Motions in Limine
#1 - Attys make record that there will be a stipulation as to chain of custody; Court reserves defense' right to object to anything they believe would be a violation of Crawford.  
#2 - Addressed through the stipulation of parties.  
#3 - State has filed an Amended Information.  
#4 - State objects.  Argument by Attys.  Defense is allowed inquire of officer as to why they conducted their investigation.  Court has previously ruled the defense cannot bring any evidence with regard to another suspect.  Atty Buting asks for clarification, re:  other people who having access to this computer.  
#5 - State will run records of any witnesses.  
#6 - Defense has a consulting expert and asks he be an exception to the exclusion rule.  He may or may not testify.  Argument by Atty Johnson.  Argument by Atty Buting.  Court orders that both experts can be present during the entire trial.  Other witnesses will be excluded until they are called to testify.  
#7 - State is checking to see if any witness has a record.  
#8 - State has complied.  
#9 - Court will read list of witnesses.  Parties to coordinate 1 list of all of the witnesses.  
#10 - Granted.  
#12 - Court makes record as to preliminary instructions Court gives.  Jurors will not be asking questions of witnesses.  
#13 - Yes - Instructions are given in written form.  
Court will seat 14 jurors - there will be 2 alternates.  Court will initially seat 24 jurors in the box for voir dire.  Atty Buting has until Monday at 8:30 am to object if he disagrees with number of jurors to be seated.  
12:30 pm  Atty Johnson makes record as to offer made to the defense and the counter offer made by the defense.  Response by Atty Buting and Mr. Pillman to Court's question.  Mr. Pillman confirms he is rejecting the offer.  Atty Buting confirms that they are not making an request for an adjournment.  Response by Mr. Pillman to Court's question confirming that he his not requesting an adjournment.  
12:34 pm  Court in recess until 8:30 am Monday morning.
Letter to Judge requesting extension on response

10:30 am FINAL PRE-TRIAL CALENDAR:  
11:24 am  Court in session. Case called.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Carlin C Pillman in court with Attys Jerome Buting and Larry David Steen.  
Matter is before the Court for final pre-trial.  
Atty Buting makes record as to issues that need to be clarified.  
Court saw the State's Motion in limine and has just now seen the defense Motion in Limine.  
Atty Johnson agrees that the Information needs to be amended and will be doing so.  
State will be providing report of the new expert.  The person who previously prepared the report is no longer employed by DCI so it was examined by another expert with the same results.  Response by Atty Buting requesting that the State specify and let defense know exactly what images are intended to be introduced at trial.  The defense needs clarification as to what other files the State is intending to use.  Response by Atty Johnson that there are only 3 images they are charging him with and which have been shown to the defense.  The State does not intend to show the jury all of the images.  Court can put this over to next week Friday at 11:30 am for further pre-trial.  Court agrees that the State needs to be specific  Any writing by the defense in opposition is to be filed by Wednesday at 4:00 pm.  Atty Steen indicates it is important that they be provided with the date and time as to when the images were downloaded onto his computer.  Response by Atty Buting asking State to summarize what their expert would testify to with regard to any differences in the dates.  There is no Daubert challenge by either side as to experts.  Court would like Defense to submit Order as to prior Denny motion that the Court heard and denied.  11:36 am  Court in recess.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 29, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Motion Hearing before the Honorable Kristine Drettwan on June 19, 2017
Court Reporter Linda Matoska

11:01 am  Court in Session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Carlin C Pillman in court with Attys Jerome Buting and Larry David Steen.  
Matter is on this morning for a Motion in Limine with regard to requested Denny evidence.  Court has reviewed the Motion and the State's Brief in Response.  
11:02 am  Argument by Atty Buting with regard to additional information they have requested from the State as to a third party suspect and which the State is not releasing.  Response by Atty Buting to Court's question as to how they intend to introduce this evidence.  
11:13 am  Argument by Atty Wiedenfeld.  He does not believe there has been sufficient evidence offered by the defense with regard to motive, opportunity or a direct connection to the offense.  Atty Wiedenfeld makes record with regard to the referrals the DA's office received.  
11:22 am  Response by Atty Wiedenfeld to Court's questions.  11:27 am  Response by Atty Buting.  
11:29 am  Further response by Atty Buting as to Court's questions regarding dates of videos.  
11:31 am  Response by Atty Wiedenfeld that there is a DCI report showing last access dates.  
11:32 am  Further argument by Atty Buting.  
11:33 am  Court proceeds with making its record.  1st question for Court - Did third party have motive; Court makes findings and doesn't believe motive has been shown.  Court can't make a finding that there is the required degree of similarity.  Court makes finding as to opportunity.  The defense has not shown that the third party could have committed it and had a direct connection to the crime.  Court denies Motion in Limine.  
11:48 am  Discussion between Court and Attys with regard to potential of any other motions.  Case is set for FPT and Jury Trial.  
11:49 am  Atty Buting will prepare Order for Court's signature.  Court in recess.

**AMENDMENT 1-9-2015 - BOND MODIFIED TO ALLOW CONTACT WITH AMELIA AND CLAIRE, CHILDREN OF DEFENDANT'S BROTHER AS LONG AS ONE OF THE CHILD'S PARENTS IS PRESENT TO SUPERVISE. THE WEEKEND WITH THE CHILDREN IS BEING INCREASED FROM 2 HOURS TO 6 HOURS AND THE SCHEDULE IS TO BE DETERMINED BY THE MOTHER.

**BOND AMENDMENT 09-26-2014 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant may go home two (2) hours a week on Saturday or Sunday, or split the two (2) hours between those two (2) days, but only when the child's mother is present. Grandparents may also act as supervisors of children in addition to the mother.

NO CONTACT WITH MINORS. NO USE OF INTERNET. DEFENDANT MUST RESIDE WITH HIS PARENTS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.  14-3926

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carlin C Pillman in court with attorney Larry D. Steen.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond is granted. Preliminary hearing requested. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

**BOND AMENDMENT 09-26-2014 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant may go home two (2) hours a week on Saturday or Sunday, or split the two (2) hours between those two (2) days, but only when the child's mother is present. Grandparents may also act as supervisors of children in addition to the mother.
